meanings.definition: To eat food in small bites
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was nibbling on a carrot.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys nibbling on popcorn while watching movies.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was nibbling away at the nuts, looking quite content.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be nibbling away at the edges of her memory.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was happily nibbling on a cookie, leaving crumbs everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The puppy was nibbling on his owner's shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The kitten nibbled on the string, playing with it.
meanings.sent3: The baby was nibbling on his toy, pretending to be a little monster.
meanings.sent4: Her words nibbled at his heart, leaving a bittersweet feeling.
meanings.sent5: The breeze felt like it was gently nibbling at her skin as she walked.

meanings.definition: To make small, quick bites or cuts
meanings.sent1: The scissors were nibbling through the paper effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The beaver was nibbling on the tree trunk to build its dam.
meanings.sent3: The artist was nibbling away at the clay to create intricate details.
meanings.sent4: The wind felt like it was nibbling at the edges of the tent.
meanings.sent5: The chisel was nibbling away at the marble, slowly revealing the sculpture within.
